headline.main: A Cross, a Shield, and a Prayer for Firefighters

lead_paragraph: THE REV. CHRISTOPHER KEENAN'S pager was purring again. Its screen was alight with news of a fire in Chelsea, and instantly he was checking in with the Fire Department's war room in Brooklyn. ''No? Don't need me? O.K.,'' he said. ''Peace, my brother.'' Father Chris, as he is known to all, is now on call. And he has been, 24-7, ever since Nov. 16, when he stood in the long brown habit and sandals of the Franciscan friar at Fire Department headquarters and received his red and gold chaplain's shield.
abstract: Public Lives profile of Rev Christopher Keenan, new fire department chaplain appointed to succeed Rev Mychal F Judge, who was killed at World Trade Center while giving last rites to fallen; photo (M)
